latestVersion.termsOfUse: You can use the data for statistical analysis, and to generate figure derived from statistical analysis, always when you cite the data together with authors.
latestVersion.confidentialityDeclaration: As far as I know, the use of this data does not affect interests of any third party person or organization. It may affect only the authors of the data if not used in accordance of this Term of use.
latestVersion.availabilityStatus: The data are available only through Harvard Dataverse.
latestVersion.restrictions: Do not use this data for publication without citing them. If the data are used extensively in your study, please, consider to include the owner of the data as coauthor. Do not provide the data to other persons: each interested person should download them personally from Harvard Dataverse.
latestVersion.citationRequirements: You should cite the data as provided by Harvard Dataverse.

fields.value: Replication Data for: Secondary compounds in two sexual form of Opuntia robusta from Central-Eastern México

authorAffiliation.value: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México
Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Universidad Autónoma del Estado de México

dsDescriptionValue.value: Dataset contain contains absorbances and concentrations of 4-hydroxybenzoic acid, chlorogenic acid and quercetine in the cladodes of hermaphrodite and female individuals of Opuntia robusta, growing at San Nicolas Tecoaco, Municipality of Singuilucan, Hidalgo State, Central-Eastern Mexico, as well as the results of statistical analysis.

grantNumberAgency.value: Consejo Nacional de Ciencia y Tecnología

files.description: Morphometric traits, cladode order counted from soil, number of cladodes above a given clacode, date of sampling, spine color (cladode age estimator) absorbanse (surface belowe the absorbance curve), calibrations equations, and concentration of 4-hydroxybenzoic acid (4-HBA), quercetine (QUE), salicilic acid (SAL), and chlorogenic acid (CGA) obtained from the calibration equations, for females and hermafrodite cladodes of Opuntia robusta.
files.label: Supporting Table S1_Concentrations of secondary metabolites for two sexual forms of Opuntia robusta.tab

files.description:
Meteorological data for Singuilucan Municipality, 2014
Meteorological Data 2014 - Averege or additive per-month data
Grapphics - Histograms for average and additive variables
Graphics Per-Day - Graphics for sampling day
Coef Determ - Coefficients of determination and t-test probabolity for correlation coefficiens; per-month average or additive variables
Coef Determ_Per-Day - Coefficients of determination and t-test probabolity for correlation coefficiens; averages or sums for additive variables for the samplig day
Correl. Per-Month vs. Per-Day - correlations coefficients, coefficients of determination, and t-test probability, fore the relationship among per-month and per-sampling-day data
March-October - meteorological data for March through October 2014
Lackind data that were adjusted, are marked with red fonts

Data obtained from: clima.inifap.gob.mx
files.label: Supporting Table S2_Meteorological data 2014.tab

files.description:
We model the probability that the substance is present. Positive value of the coefficient of the model means that with the increase of the independent variable the probability of the presence of the substance also increases.
age categories are based on color of spines: 1=yellowish, 2=yellow white base, 3=white yellowish, 4=white, 5=gray white, 6=black

files.description: Reults of the statistical tests for the effect of the sexual form, cladode size, month, cladode age, and cladode position, on the proportion of cladodes bearing 4-hydroxybenzoic acid (4-HBA), chlorogenic acid (CGA), and quercetine (QUE).
files.label: Supporting Table S4_Desriptive Stats.doc

dataFile.description: Reults of the statistical tests for the effect of the sexual form, cladode size, month, cladode age, and cladode position, on the proportion of cladodes bearing 4-hydroxybenzoic acid (4-HBA), chlorogenic acid (CGA), and quercetine (QUE).

files.description:
Least square linear reggression functions for the relationships between the proportions of cladodes bearing 4-HBA, CGA, and QUE for cladodes arranged by age or by month of sapling.
Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
1 – yellowish, 2 – yellow, white base, 3 – white yellowish, 4 – white, 5 – grayish, 6 – black, being “1” the youngest, and “6”, the oldest age class.

4-HBA = 4-Hydroxybenzoic acid
CGA = Chlorogenic acid
QUE = Quercetin
files.label: Supporting Table S5_Regressions1.tab

dataFile.description:
Least square linear reggression functions for the relationships between the proportions of cladodes bearing 4-HBA, CGA, and QUE for cladodes arranged by age or by month of sapling.
Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
1 – yellowish, 2 – yellow, white base, 3 – white yellowish, 4 – white, 5 – grayish, 6 – black, being “1” the youngest, and “6”, the oldest age class.

4-HBA = 4-Hydroxybenzoic acid
CGA = Chlorogenic acid
QUE = Quercetin

files.description:
Least square linear regression functions for the relationship between cladode order from soil or nr of cladodes above, and cladode age estimator based on the color of the spines.
Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
1 – yellowish, 2 – yellow, white base, 3 – white yellowish, 4 – white, 5 – grayish, 6 – black, being “1” the youngest, and “6”, the oldest age class.
We pooled the data for hermaphrodites and for females, since there were no significant intersexual differences among slopes for these relationships.
Additionally, we performed the analysis for ln-transformed data, to obtain a probability estimation for continuous data.

To obtain a ln for "0" data and non-zero transformation for "1" data, we added "1" (cladode order or cladode age) or "1.1" (no of cladodes above) to the data.
files.label: Supporting Table S6_Regressions2.tab

dataFile.description:
Least square linear regression functions for the relationship between cladode order from soil or nr of cladodes above, and cladode age estimator based on the color of the spines.
Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
1 – yellowish, 2 – yellow, white base, 3 – white yellowish, 4 – white, 5 – grayish, 6 – black, being “1” the youngest, and “6”, the oldest age class.
We pooled the data for hermaphrodites and for females, since there were no significant intersexual differences among slopes for these relationships.
Additionally, we performed the analysis for ln-transformed data, to obtain a probability estimation for continuous data.

To obtain a ln for "0" data and non-zero transformation for "1" data, we added "1" (cladode order or cladode age) or "1.1" (no of cladodes above) to the data.

files.description:
Least square linear regression functions for the relationship between cladode length
and cladode order from soil or cladode age.
Age estimator is based on the color of the spines.
Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
1 – yellowish, 2 – yellow, white base, 3 – white yellowish, 4 – white, 5 – grayish, 6 – black, being “1” the youngest, and “6”, the oldest age class.
We compared slopes between sexual forms, for these relationships.
files.label: Supporting Table S7_Slope comparison.tab

files.description:
Least square linear regression functions for the relationship between cladode length
and cladode order from soil or cladode age; slope, intercept and  shift in elevation comparison between sexual forms (female and hermaphrodite plants).
Age estimator is based on the color of the spines.
Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
1 – yellowish, 2 – yellow, white base, 3 – white yellowish, 4 – white, 5 – grayish, 6 – black, being “1” the youngest, and “6”, the oldest age class.
files.label: Supporting Table S8_Slope, intercept, shift in elevation test_comparison between sexual form test.txt

Cladode age classes corresponded to the color of the spines in the fallowing manner:
